result.execSummary:
The defendant Codey R. Opper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID as is the defendant himself. IID installation fee to be paid.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber if eligible for work, school, or treatment.Must report within 45 days or discretion of the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed.

miscConds.notes:
Court vacated Plea/Sentencing held on September 22, 2014.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes:
Jail with huber if eligible for work, school, treatment and AA.
Defendant must report within 45 days or at discretion of the agent.
No objection to EMP.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called: 2:21pm. INCLUDES 14CF379, 14CF807, 14CF837. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant appears in custody by and with Atty James Connell. State makes statement re: plea hearing held yesterday. Atty Connell in agreement. Crt addresses defendant and admonishes defendant. Crt vacates Plea/Sentencing along with Waiver of Prelim in 14CF479.  Waiver of Prelim. filed 14CF479. Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Information previously filed. Crt proceeds with Plea. Plea/Advisement filed. State moves to DRI 14CF807 & 14CF837-crt grants. PLEA: GUILTY - ct 1 (OWI-4th) 14CF479. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Atty Connell makes statement. Defendant makes statement. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 3 yrs. CONDITIONS: $3,014.00 inclusive cc; 6 months MCJ w/huber if eligible for work, school, treatment and AA; 1 day credit; must report w/in 45 days or discretion of the agent;  No objection to EMP; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 36 months as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed; $50 IID installation fee to be paid; 36 months dl revocation; AODA-Cty Resident; Absolute Sobriety- Alcohol. Crt advises and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Acknowledgment. Adjourned: 2:39pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 10:36am. INCLUDES 14CF479, 14CF807. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Sid Brucbacher. Deft appears in person with Atty James Connell. Parties do not object BR 5 handling BR 4 case. Waiver of Prelim. filed 14CF479. Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Information filed.  Crt proceeds with Plea. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI 14CF807- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (OWI-4th). Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Atty Connell makes statement. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 2 yrs & 6 months. CONDITIONS: $3,014.00 inclusive cc; 6 months MCJ w/huber if eligible for work, school or treatment; must report w/in 45 days or discretion of the agent;  Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 36 months as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed; $50 IID installation fee to be paid; 36 months dl revocation; AODA-Cty Resident; Absolute Sobriety. Crt advises and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Acknowledgment. Adjourned: 10:48am.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 1 business day - Day Report Program.
Adjourned to July 8, 2014 @ 2:00 pm.  In treatment in Tennessee.
